articles.description:

summary: A viral social media post highlights boundary issues faced by travelers on flights.

Local travelers are discussing personal space and etiquette on flights, impacting future travel behaviors.

articles.title: Is your home ready for this winter?
articles.description:
What to know about snow loads, ice dams, storm prep, and even caring for your yard when everything’s frozen.

The post Is your home ready for this winter? appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Prepare homes for winter to prevent ice dams and snow load damage.
Check roofs and gutters before the first snowfall expected in December.
Proper yard care can prevent frozen plants and enhance winter resilience.

articles.title: What Boston meteorologists are saying about the timing and impacts of Wednesday’s snow
articles.description:
As New England continues to dig out from a blizzard, meteorologists say to expect some light snow mixed with rain before much melting takes place.

The post What Boston meteorologists are saying about the timing and impacts of Wednesday’s snow appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Meteorologists predict light snow mixed with rain for Boston on Wednesday.
Residents are still recovering from a recent blizzard affecting the area.
Expect minimal melting before the new snow arrives, impacting travel conditions.

articles.title: Some changes are in store for Kendall Square Cinema
articles.description:
Landmark Theatres says upgrades will begin next month to modernize the longtime Cambridge movie house.

The post Some changes are in store for Kendall Square Cinema appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Landmark Theatres will begin upgrades at Kendall Square Cinema in March 2024.
The renovations aim to modernize the 30-year-old movie house for better audience experience.
Local residents can expect improved facilities and technology enhancing their movie-going experience.

articles.title: View Boston to shutter observatory restaurants, cut 79 jobs
articles.description:
View Boston is ending restaurant service at its three-story observatory atop the Prudential Center, shifting toward hosting more private events.

The post View Boston to shutter observatory restaurants, cut 79 jobs appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: View Boston will close its observatory restaurants at the Prudential Center.
79 jobs will be eliminated due to the service shutdown.
The venue will focus on hosting more private events instead.

His performance could enhance the Red Sox's pitching depth for the upcoming season.

articles.title: 8 takeaways from Trump’s State of the Union address
articles.description:
Much of the nation is worried about the direction of the economy, but Trump says the good times are here, insisting repeatedly that rising costs are no longer a problem.

The post 8 takeaways from Trump’s State of the Union address appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Trump claims the economy is thriving despite rising costs affecting many Boston residents.
He emphasized patriotism and economic growth during his address on February 25, 2026.
Local businesses may face challenges as residents remain concerned about inflation and expenses.

articles.title: Boston couple’s wedding disrupted by blizzard — they got married anyway
articles.description:
Their planned ceremony at the Boston Public Library fell through, but the couple married in a hotel suite as snow blanketed the city.

The post Boston couple’s wedding disrupted by blizzard — they got married anyway appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Boston couple married in a hotel suite on February 25 due to blizzard conditions.
Their original ceremony at the Boston Public Library was canceled because of heavy snowfall.
The couple's adaptability highlights resilience amid challenging weather for local residents.

articles.title: Dave Epstein: How long will it take for all this snow to melt?
articles.description:
"We also don’t want this to be melting too quickly or else we would have a lot of flooding."

The post Dave Epstein: How long will it take for all this snow to melt? appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Dave Epstein predicts gradual snowmelt to avoid flooding in Boston.
Rapid melting could lead to significant flooding issues for residents.
Residents should prepare for potential water management challenges this spring.
